Loading Indicators

Loading indicators appear before page content finishes loading, to indicate to the user that the site is still working and that they should wait to interact with the page until loading is complete.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Inline Loading

New John Deere 469 Silage Special Round Baler
$5,678.44

Loading...
Vehicle ID 100000038232

RRS Date -

Medium Indeterminate Loading

Determinate Loading (Progress Bars)

25%
15 of 20 Items Approved
60%
Copy

Guidelines

  • Use a preloader if your site takes longer than 2 seconds to load.
  • Five different sizes are available, depending on the location and quantity of content that is being loaded.
    • Use smaller preloaders for tiles or sections within a page.
    • Use larger preloaders for large sections of content or entire pages.

Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.active add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to apply animation
.progress-loaded-uxf-% add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to animate the progress indicator to a fixed percentage (Ex. .progress-loaded-uxf-58 will animate the progress indicator to the 58% mark)
.progress-uxf-xl add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to apply extra-large preloader styles
.progress-uxf-lg add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to apply large preloader styles
.progress-uxf-sm add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to apply small preloader styles
.progress-uxf-xs add class to .progress-circles-uxf element to apply extra-small preloader styles
